content:
TITLE: Installing Portainer BE via Helm with Ingress Exposure DESCRIPTION: Helm command to install Portainer Business Edition exposed via an Ingress controller, configuring it with TLS and specific host settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm upgrade --install --create-namespace -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer \ --set enterpriseEdition.enabled=true \ --set enterpriseEdition.image.tag=lts \ --set service.type=ClusterIP \ --set tls.force=true \ --set ingress.enabled=true \ --set ingress.ingressClassName= \ --set ingress.annotations."nginx\.ingress\.kubernetes\.io/backend-protocol"=HTTPS \ --set ingress.hosts[0].host= \ --set ingress.hosts[0].paths[0].path="/" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Roles and Permissions Legend Table in Markdown DESCRIPTION: A markdown table defining the abbreviations and full names of different user roles in the Portainer system. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/docker-roles-and-permissions.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ```
AbbreviationRole name
EAEnvironment Administrator
OPOperator
HDHelpdesk
STStandard user
RORead-only user
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Portainer Business Edition with Traefik DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration that sets up Traefik as a reverse proxy with SSL support and Portainer Business Edition. Includes container definitions, volume mappings, and Traefik labels for routing. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: "3.3" services: traefik: container_name: traefik image: "traefik:latest" command: - --entrypoints.web.address=:80 - --entrypoints.websecure.address=:443 - --providers.docker - --log.level=ERROR - --certificatesresolvers.leresolver.acme.httpchallenge=true - --certificatesresolvers.leresolver.acme.email=your-email - --certificatesresolvers.leresolver.acme.storage=./acme.json - --certificatesresolvers.leresolver.acme.httpchallenge.entrypoint=web ports: - "80:80" - "443:443" volumes: - "/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro" - "./acme.json:/acme.json" labels: - "traefik.http.routers.http-catchall.rule=hostregexp(`{host:.+}`)" - "traefik.http.routers.http-catchall.entrypoints=web" - "traefik.http.routers.http-catchall.middlewares=redirect-to-https" - "traefik.http.middlewares.redirect-to-https.redirectscheme.scheme=https" portainer: image: portainer/portainer-ee:lts command: -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock restart: always volumes: - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock - portainer_data:/data labels: # Frontend - "traefik.enable=true" - "traefik.http.routers.frontend.rule=Host(`portainer.yourdomain.com`)" - "traefik.http.routers.frontend.entrypoints=websecure" - "traefik.http.services.frontend.loadbalancer.server.port=9000" - "traefik.http.routers.frontend.service=frontend" - "traefik.http.routers.frontend.tls.certresolver=leresolver" # Edge - "traefik.http.routers.edge.rule=Host(`edge.yourdomain.com`)" - "traefik.http.routers.edge.entrypoints=websecure" - "traefik.http.services.edge.loadbalancer.server.port=8000" - "traefik.http.routers.edge.service=edge" - "traefik.http.routers.edge.tls.certresolver=leresolver" volumes: portainer_data: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Tables for Docker RBAC Documentation DESCRIPTION: Series of markdown tables documenting permissions for different Docker operations across various user roles. Includes containers, images, volumes, networks, events, and configs sections with detailed permission mappings. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/docker-roles-and-permissions.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` ### Containers
OperationEAOPHDSTRONotes
View containerstruetruetruetruetrue1
### Images
OperationEAOPHDSTRONotes
View imagestruetruetruetruetrue
### Volumes
OperationEAOPHDSTRONotes
View volumestruetruetruetruetrue1
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer Server Container DESCRIPTION: Deploys the Portainer Server container with required port mappings (8000, 9443), volume mounts for Docker socket and data persistence, and automatic restart configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/docker/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer --restart=always -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ce:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Portainer Server via Load Balancer in Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands to access Portainer Server using Load Balancer method. Users should replace '' with the IP address or FQDN of the load balancer, and adjust the port if changed during setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/kubernetes/baremetal.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://:9443/ or http://:9000/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Server Container DESCRIPTION: Runs the Portainer Server container with necessary port mappings (8000, 9443), volume mounts for Docker socket and data storage, and automatic restart configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/docker/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer --restart=always -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ce:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Portainer Access Restrictions for Different User Roles DESCRIPTION: This markdown table outlines the access restrictions and permissions for different Portainer user roles including Endpoint admin, Operator, Helpdesk, Standard User, and Read-only User. It covers various functions such as namespace scope, application management, and cluster operations. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/kubernetes-roles-and-bindings.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Function | Endpoint admin | Operator | Helpdesk | Standard User | Read-only User | | --------------------------- | -------------- | ------------------ | ------------------ | ------------------ | ------------------ | | Namespace Scope | All | All, EXCEPT System | All, EXCEPT System | Default + Assigned | Default + Assigned | | Namespaces | RW | R | R | R | R | | Namespace Details | RW | R | R | R | R | | Namespace Access Management | RW | | | | | | Applications | RW | R | R | RW | R | | Application Details | RW | R | R | RW | R | | Pod Delete | Yes | Yes | | | | | Application Console | RW | RW | | | | | Advanced Deployment | RW | | | RW | | | ConfigMaps & Secrets | RW | R | R | RW | R | | ConfigMap & Secret Details | RW | RW | R | RW | R | | Volumes | RW | R | R | RW | R | | Volume Details | RW | R | R | RW | R | | Cluster | RW | R | R | | | | Cluster Node View | RW | R | R | | | | Cluster Setup | RW | | | | | | Application Error Details | R | R | R | | | | Storage Class Disabled | R | R | R | | | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Business Edition Container DESCRIPTION: This command runs the Portainer BE container, mapping necessary ports, mounting volumes for Docker socket and data storage, and setting restart policy. It uses the 'portainer/portainer-ee:lts' image. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/docker/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer --restart=always -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ee:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Portainer Agent with Host Filesystem Access in Docker DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to start the Portainer Agent on Docker on Linux, including mounting the host filesystem at /host. It also mounts the Docker socket and volumes directory. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/host/setup.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 9001:9001 --name portainer_agent --restart=always -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /var/lib/docker/volumes:/var/lib/docker/volumes -v /:/host portainer/agent:2.22.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Portainer Community Edition Roles and Bindings DESCRIPTION: This markdown table defines the roles and their corresponding cluster and namespace role bindings for Portainer Community Edition. It shows the differences between Admin and User roles in terms of access restrictions. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/kubernetes-roles-and-bindings.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Portainer Role | Cluster Role Binding | Namespace Role Binding | | -------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------- | | Admin | (no restriction) | (no restriction) | | User | [portainer-cr-user](kubernetes-roles-and-bindings.md#portainer-cr-user) | edit (default k8s role, only assigned namespaces) | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Server Container on Windows DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to deploy Portainer Server on Windows Container Service. The command maps ports 8000 and 9443, names the container, sets it to restart automatically, and mounts the Docker pipe and data volume. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/docker/wcs.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer --restart always -v \\.\pipe\docker_engine:\\.\pipe\docker_engine -v portainer_data:C:\data portainer/portainer-ce:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Structure of App Template JSON Format DESCRIPTION: The basic structure for app template definitions, showing how templates are organized in an array within a version object. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "version": "2", "templates": [ { // template1 }, { // template2 }, ... ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Portainer BE Version Compatibility Table DESCRIPTION: Markdown table showing version compatibility between Portainer Business Edition releases and container platforms. Includes release dates, supported Docker versions, Kubernetes versions, Podman versions, and supported architectures. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/requirements-and-prerequisites.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Portainer Version | Release Date | Docker Version | Kubernetes Version | Podman Version | Architectures | | ----------------------------------------------------- | ------------------ | ------------------------- | ------------------------ | -------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | | [Business 2.27.3](../release-notes.md#release-2.27.3) | March 25, 2025 | 26.0.2 27.0.3 | 1.29 1.30 1.31 | 5.2.3 | [ARM64](https://portal.portainer.io/knowledge/which-arm-architectures-does-portainer-support), x86\_64 | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Stack to Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the Portainer stack to Docker Swarm using the downloaded YAML manifest file. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/swarm/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker stack deploy -c portainer-agent-stack.yml portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Server Container with Podman DESCRIPTION: Runs the Portainer Server container, mapping necessary ports and volumes. This command sets up Portainer BE with access to the Podman socket and persistent data storage. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/podman/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` podman run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer --restart=always --privileged -v /run/podman/podman.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ee:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating JWT Authentication Token for Portainer API DESCRIPTION: HTTP POST request to authenticate and generate a JWT token. This token is required for authorization when making API calls to Portainer. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/api.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` http POST https://my-portainer-server:9443/api/auth Username="admin" Password="adminpassword" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Server with mTLS on Docker Standalone DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to start Portainer Server with mTLS support by mounting certificates and specifying the required mTLS parameters. Requires CA certificate, server certificate, and server key to be available at the specified path. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/mtls.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer --restart=always \ -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \ -v portainer_data:/data \ -v /root/certs:/certs \ portainer/portainer-ee:lts \ --mtlscacert /certs/mtlsca.crt \ --mtlscert /certs/mtlsserver.crt \ --mtlskey /certs/mtlsserver.key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Required Azure Permissions for Portainer Integration DESCRIPTION: Lists the specific Azure permissions needed for Portainer to interact with Azure services. These permissions allow Portainer to read and write to managed Kubernetes clusters, handle deployments, and access resource groups. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/settings/credentials/aks.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` Microsoft.ContainerService/managedClusters/read Microsoft.ContainerService/managedClusters/write Microsoft.Resources/deployments/* Microsoft.Resources/subscriptions/resourcegroups/read Microsoft.Resources/subscriptions/resourcegroups/write Microsoft.Resources/subscriptions/read Microsoft.ContainerService/managedClusters/listClusterAdminCredential/action ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Upgrading Portainer to Business Edition using Helm on Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: This Helm command upgrades Portainer to the Business Edition while maintaining existing deployment settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/tobe/kubernetes.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm upgrade -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer --set enterpriseEdition.enabled=true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Password Reset Helper for Docker Standalone DESCRIPTION: These commands pull and run the password reset helper container for Portainer, mounting the Portainer data volume. The helper will either update the existing admin password or create a new admin user. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reset-admin.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker pull portainer/helper-reset-password docker run --rm -v portainer_data:/data portainer/helper-reset-password ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Portainer Business Edition Server on Docker Linux DESCRIPTION: Deploys the Portainer Business Edition server container with appropriate port mappings, volume mounts, and restart policy. Maps ports 8000 and 9443, mounts the Docker socket and data volume, and uses the LTS version of the Portainer EE image. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/docker/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer --restart=always -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ee:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Authenticating Against Portainer API with Admin Credentials DESCRIPTION: Performs authentication against the Portainer API using admin credentials to receive a JWT token for subsequent API calls. The token is valid for 8 hours. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/api/examples.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` http POST /api/auth Username="" Password="" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Portainer Community Edition with Nginx Proxy DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for deploying Portainer Community Edition behind Nginx reverse proxy in a standalone Docker environment. Uses nginxproxy/nginx-proxy for automatic proxy configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/nginx.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: "2" services: nginx-proxy: image: nginxproxy/nginx-proxy restart: always ports: - "80:80" volumes: - "/var/run/docker.sock:/tmp/docker.sock:ro" portainer: image: portainer/portainer-ce:lts command: -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock restart: always environment: - VIRTUAL_HOST=portainer.yourdomain.com - VIRTUAL_PORT=9000 ports: - 8000:8000 volumes: - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock - portainer_data:/data volumes: portainer_data: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Password Reset Pod YAML for Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: This command creates a YAML file for a password reset pod in Kubernetes. The pod mounts the Portainer persistent volume claim to access the database and reset the password. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reset-admin.md#2025-04-13_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` cat > passreset.yml<< EOF apiVersion: v1 kind: Pod metadata: name: passreset spec: volumes: - name: data persistentVolumeClaim: claimName: portainer containers: - name: passreset image: portainer/helper-reset-password volumeMounts: - mountPath: "/data" name: data restartPolicy: Never EOF ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Specifying Platform for Portainer Template in JSON DESCRIPTION: Shows how to define the supported platform for a template, which affects the icon displayed in the Portainer UI. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_21 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "platform": "linux" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Generating Kubeconfig for On-premise Kubernetes Clusters DESCRIPTION: Command to generate a flattened and minified kubeconfig file for on-premise Kubernetes clusters using kubectl. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/kubernetes/import.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl config view --flatten=true --minify=true > kubeconfig.yml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Docker Secrets for mTLS Certificates DESCRIPTION: Commands to create Docker secrets for the CA certificate, client certificate, and client key. These secrets will be used in the Edge Agent deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/mtls.md#2025-04-13_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker secret create portainer.mtlscacert /root/certs/mtlsca.crt docker secret create portainer.mtlscert /root/certs/client.crt docker secret create portainer.mtlskey /root/certs/client.key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Edge Agent with mTLS on Docker Standalone DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to deploy a Portainer Edge Agent with mTLS support. Mounts the required certificates and sets the necessary environment variables for secure communication with the Portainer Server. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/mtls.md#2025-04-13_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d \ -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \ -v /var/lib/docker/volumes:/var/lib/docker/volumes \ -v /:/host \ -v /root/certs:/certs \ -v portainer_agent_data:/data \ --restart always \ -e EDGE=1 \ -e EDGE_ID=your-edge-id \ -e EDGE_KEY=your-edge-key \ -e EDGE_INSECURE_POLL=0 \ --name portainer_edge_agent \ portainer/agent:lts \ --mtlscacert /certs/mtlsca.crt \ --mtlscert /certs/client.crt \ --mtlskey /certs/client.key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Admin Password in Portainer API DESCRIPTION: Creates an admin account on a fresh Portainer installation. This API call sets up the initial admin username and password, which is required before using Portainer. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/api/examples.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` http POST /api/users/admin/init Username="" Password="" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Portainer Container Status DESCRIPTION: Example output of docker ps command showing the running Portainer Server and Agent containers. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/swarm/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` root@manager01:~# docker ps CONTAINER ID IMAGE COMMAND CREATED STATUS PORTS NAMES 59ee466f6b15 portainer/agent:lts "./agent" About a minute ago Up About a minute portainer_agent.xbb8k6r7j1tk9gozjku7e43wr.5sa6b3e8cl6hyu0snlt387sgv 2db7dd4bfba0 portainer/portainer-ce:lts "/portainer -H tcp:/…" About a minute ago Up About a minute 8000/tcp, 9443/tcp portainer_portainer.1.gpuvu3pqmt1m19zxfo44v7izx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Container Ports Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure port mappings for a template, with both explicit host:container mappings and container-only specifications. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "ports": ["8080:80/tcp", "443/tcp"] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Environment Variables Definition in Docker Compose DESCRIPTION: Shows how to define environment variables in a Docker Compose file using the environment block. Variables defined in Portainer can be referenced using ${VARIABLE_NAME} syntax. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/stacks/add.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` environment: MY_ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE: ${MY_ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Portainer Container Status with Docker PS DESCRIPTION: Displays the running Docker containers to verify that the Portainer Server container is running correctly. Shows container ID, image, command, creation time, status, mapped ports, and container name. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/docker/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` root@server:~# docker ps CONTAINER ID IMAGE COMMAND CREATED STATUS PORTS NAMES de5b28eb2fa9 portainer/portainer-ee:lts "/portainer" 2 weeks ago Up 9 days 0.0.0.0:8000->8000/tcp, :::8000->8000/tcp, 0.0.0.0:9443->9443/tcp, :::9443->9443/tcp portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer with Custom SSL Certificate on Docker Standalone DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to deploy Portainer with custom SSL certificate and key. Mounts certificate files from host to container and specifies them using --sslcert and --sslkey flags. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/ssl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 9443:9443 -p 8000:8000 \ --name portainer --restart always \ -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \ -v portainer_data:/data \ -v /path/to/your/certs:/certs \ portainer/portainer-ee:lts \ --sslcert /certs/portainer.crt \ --sslkey /certs/portainer.key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Business Edition with Podman DESCRIPTION: This command deploys the latest version of Portainer Business Edition using Podman. It sets up necessary port mappings, volume mounts, and uses the privileged mode for full functionality. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/tobe/podman.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` podman run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9000:9000 -p 9443:9443 --name=portainer --restart=always --pull=always --privileged -v /run/podman/podman.sock:/run/podman/podman.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ee:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: JWT Token Response Format from Portainer Authentication DESCRIPTION: Sample response from the authentication API call showing the JWT token structure. This token must be used in the authorization header for authenticated API requests. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/api/examples.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "jwt":"eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6MSwidXNlcm5hbWUiOiJhZG1pbiIsInJvbGUiOjEsImV4cCI6MTQ5OTM3NjE1NH0.NJ6vE8FY1WG6jsRQzfMqeatJ4vh2TWAeeYfDhP71YEE" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Server Container with Podman DESCRIPTION: Runs the Portainer Server container, mapping necessary ports and volumes. This command sets up Portainer with SSL on port 9443 and a TCP tunnel on port 8000. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/podman/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` podman run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer --restart=always --privileged -v /run/podman/podman.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ce:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Encrypted Portainer Stack Deployment in Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose file for deploying Portainer in Swarm mode with database encryption enabled, including agent and network configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/db-encryption.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: '3.2' services: agent: image: portainer/agent:lts volumes: - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock - /var/lib/docker/volumes:/var/lib/docker/volumes networks: - agent_network deploy: mode: global placement: constraints: [node.platform.os == linux] portainer: image: portainer/portainer-ee:lts command: -H tcp://tasks.agent:9001 --tlsskipverify ports: - "9443:9443" - "9000:9000" - "8000:8000" volumes: - portainer_data:/data networks: - agent_network deploy: mode: replicated replicas: 1 placement: constraints: [node.role == manager] secrets: - portainer networks: agent_network: driver: overlay attachable: true volumes: portainer_data: secrets: portainer: external: true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Container Volumes Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure volumes for a template, including standard volumes and bind mounts with readonly options. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "volumes": [ { "container": "/etc/nginx" }, { "container": "/usr/share/nginx/html", "bind": "/var/www", "readonly": true } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer via Helm with NodePort DESCRIPTION: Helm command to install Portainer CE with NodePort exposure on HTTPS port 30779. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/baremetal.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm upgrade --install --create-namespace -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer \ --set tls.force=true \ --set image.tag=lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer BE using YAML with NodePort Exposure DESCRIPTION: kubectl command to deploy Portainer Business Edition using a YAML manifest with NodePort exposure on ports 30777 (HTTP) and 30779 (HTTPS). SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -n portainer -f https://downloads.portainer.io/ee-lts/portainer.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating SSL Certificate Secrets for Portainer on Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Docker commands to create secrets for SSL certificate and key in Docker Swarm. These secrets will be automatically detected and used by Portainer. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/ssl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker secret create portainer.sslcert /path/to/your/certificate.crt docker secret create portainer.sslkey /path/to/your/certificate.key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Docker Secrets for Portainer mTLS Certificates DESCRIPTION: Commands to create Docker secrets for storing mTLS certificates securely in a Docker Swarm environment. Creates secrets for the CA certificate, server certificate, and server key. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/mtls.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker secret create portainer.mtlscacert /root/certs/mtlsca.crt docker secret create portainer.mtlscert /root/certs/mtlsserver.crt docker secret create portainer.mtlskey /root/certs/mtlsserver.key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Initializing Admin Password in Portainer API DESCRIPTION: HTTP POST request to initialize the admin password in Portainer. This is a required first step before using the Portainer API. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/api.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` http POST https://my-portainer-server:9443/api/users/admin/init Username="admin" Password="adminpassword" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Triggering a Webhook with HTML Form DESCRIPTION: This HTML snippet demonstrates how to create a form that triggers a webhook when submitted. It includes the webhook URL and a submit button to redeploy the application. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/kubernetes/applications/webhooks.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ```
Redeploy application
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Container Privileged Mode Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to configure a container to run in privileged mode, which gives extended permissions. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "privileged": true } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Business Edition Server Container on Windows DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to deploy Portainer Business Edition Server on Windows, configuring the container to use Windows pipe for Docker communication, exposing required ports (8000 and 9443), and mounting the previously created data volume. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/docker/wcs.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer --restart always -v \\.\pipe\docker_engine:\\.\pipe\docker_engine -v portainer_data:C:\data portainer/portainer-ee:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading Portainer Stack YML Manifest for Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Curl commands to download the Portainer stack YML manifest for Docker Swarm deployment. Separate commands for Business and Community editions on Linux/Windows and Windows Container Services. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/ssl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -L https://downloads.portainer.io/ee-lts/portainer-agent-stack-ssl.yml -o portainer-agent-stack.yml ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -L https://downloads.portainer.io/ce-lts/portainer-agent-stack-ssl.yml -o portainer-agent-stack.yml ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl https://downloads.portainer.io/ee-lts/portainer-windows-stack-ssl.yml -o portainer-agent-stack.yml ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl https://downloads.portainer.io/ce-lts/portainer-windows-stack-ssl.yml -o portainer-agent-stack.yml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Portainer Community Edition with Traefik DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration that sets up Traefik as a reverse proxy with SSL support and Portainer Community Edition. Similar to Business Edition but uses the CE image. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: "3.3" services: traefik: container_name: traefik image: "traefik:latest" command: - --entrypoints.web.address=:80 - --entrypoints.websecure.address=:443 - --providers.docker - --log.level=ERROR - --certificatesresolvers.leresolver.acme.httpchallenge=true - --certificatesresolvers.leresolver.acme.email=your-email - --certificatesresolvers.leresolver.acme.storage=./acme.json - --certificatesresolvers.leresolver.acme.httpchallenge.entrypoint=web ports: - "80:80" - "443:443" volumes: - "/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro" - "./acme.json:/acme.json" labels: - "traefik.http.routers.http-catchall.rule=hostregexp(`{host:.+}`)" - "traefik.http.routers.http-catchall.entrypoints=web" - "traefik.http.routers.http-catchall.middlewares=redirect-to-https" - "traefik.http.middlewares.redirect-to-https.redirectscheme.scheme=https" portainer: image: portainer/portainer-ce:lts command: -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock restart: always volumes: - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock - portainer_data:/data labels: # Frontend - "traefik.enable=true" - "traefik.http.routers.frontend.rule=Host(`portainer.yourdomain.com`)" - "traefik.http.routers.frontend.entrypoints=websecure" - "traefik.http.services.frontend.loadbalancer.server.port=9000" - "traefik.http.routers.frontend.service=frontend" - "traefik.http.routers.frontend.tls.certresolver=leresolver" # Edge - "traefik.http.routers.edge.rule=Host(`edge.yourdomain.com`)" - "traefik.http.routers.edge.entrypoints=websecure" - "traefik.http.services.edge.loadbalancer.server.port=8000" - "traefik.http.routers.edge.service=edge" - "traefik.http.routers.edge.tls.certresolver=leresolver" volumes: portainer_data: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose configuration for Portainer Community Edition with Traefik DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for deploying Portainer Community Edition with Traefik Proxy in Docker Swarm. Similar to the Business Edition configuration but uses the portainer/portainer-ce:lts image. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: '3.2' services: traefik: image: "traefik:latest" command: - --entrypoints.web.address=:80 - --entrypoints.websecure.address=:443 - --providers.docker=true - --providers.docker.swarmMode=true - --providers.docker.exposedbydefault=false - --providers.docker.network=public - --api - --log.level=ERROR ports: - "80:80" - "443:443" networks: - public volumes: - "/var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:ro" agent: image: portainer/agent:lts environment: # REQUIRED: Should be equal to the service name prefixed by "tasks." when # deployed inside an overlay network AGENT_CLUSTER_ADDR: tasks.agent # AGENT_PORT: 9001 # LOG_LEVEL: debug volumes: - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock - /var/lib/docker/volumes:/var/lib/docker/volumes networks: - agent_network deploy: mode: global placement: constraints: [node.platform.os == linux] portainer: image: portainer/portainer-ce:lts command: -H tcp://tasks.agent:9001 --tlsskipverify volumes: - data:/data networks: - public - agent_network deploy: mode: replicated replicas: 1 placement: constraints: [node.role == manager] labels: - "traefik.enable=true" - "traefik.http.routers.portainer.rule=Host(`portainer.yourdomain.com`)" - "traefik.http.routers.portainer.entrypoints=web" - "traefik.http.services.portainer.loadbalancer.server.port=9000" - "traefik.http.routers.portainer.service=portainer" # Edge - "traefik.http.routers.edge.rule=Host(`edge.yourdomain.com`)" - "traefik.http.routers.edge.entrypoints=web" - "traefik.http.services.edge.loadbalancer.server.port=8000" - "traefik.http.routers.edge.service=edge" networks: public: external: true agent_network: external: true volumes: data: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Encrypted Portainer Container in Docker Standalone DESCRIPTION: Docker run command to start Portainer with an encrypted database, including volume mounts for the Docker socket, Portainer data, and the encryption secret. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/db-encryption.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name portainer \ --restart=always \ -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \ -v portainer_data:/data \ -v /root/secrets/portainer:/run/secrets/portainer \ portainer/portainer-ee:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding TLS-Secured Remote Docker Environment via Portainer API DESCRIPTION: HTTP POST request to add a remote environment using TLS-secured TCP communication. Requires certificate files and Docker API exposed on the specified port. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/api.md#2025-04-13_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` http --form POST https://my-portainer-server:9443/api/endpoints \ "Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6MSwidXNlcm5hbWUiOiJhZG1pbiIsInJvbGUiOjEsImV4cCI6MTQ5OTM3NjE1NH0.NJ6vE8FY1WG6jsRQzfMqeatJ4vh2TWAeeYfDhP71YEE" \ Name="test-remote-tls" URL="tcp://10.0.7.10:2376" EndpointCreationType=1 TLS="true" TLSCACertFile@/path/to/ca.pem TLSCertFile@/path/to/cert.pem TLSKeyFile@/path/to/key.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer CE 2.0.0 on Docker Standalone DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy Portainer CE 2.0.0 with persistent data and necessary port mappings. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/from-1.x.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9000:9000 --name=portainer --restart=always -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ce:2.0.0 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Helm Repository for Portainer Upgrade on Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: This command updates the Helm repository to ensure the latest version of Portainer is available for upgrade. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/tobe/kubernetes.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm repo update ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Portainer Server with mTLS in Docker Swarm YAML DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for deploying Portainer Server with mTLS support in Docker Swarm using Docker secrets. Includes service definition with command arguments for using the mTLS certificates. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/mtls.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` portainer: image: portainer/portainer-ee:lts command: -H tcp://tasks.agent:9001 --tlsskipverify --mtlscacert /run/secrets/portainer.mtlscacert --mtlscert /run/secrets/portainer.mtlscert --mtlskey /run/secrets/portainer.mtlskey ports: - "9443:9443" - "9000:9000" - "8000:8000" volumes: - portainer_data:/data networks: - agent_network deploy: mode: replicated replicas: 1 placement: constraints: [node.role == manager] secrets: - portainer.mtlscacert - portainer.mtlsscert - portainer.mtlskey ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Container Network Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to specify a network to use with the template, which will be auto-selected in the templates view. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "network": "host" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Default StorageClass in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Command to set a StorageClass as the default in a Kubernetes cluster using kubectl patch. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/baremetal.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl patch storageclass -p '{"metadata": {"annotations":{"storageclass.kubernetes.io/is-default-class":"true"}}}' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Portainer Data Volume DESCRIPTION: Creates a Docker volume to store Portainer's persistent data. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/docker/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker volume create portainer_data ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Stack Configuration for Portainer Community Edition with Nginx Proxy DESCRIPTION: Docker Stack configuration for deploying Portainer Community Edition with Nginx reverse proxy in a Swarm environment. Includes agent configuration and network setup for cluster management. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/nginx.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: '3.2' services: nginx-proxy: image: nginxproxy/nginx-proxy networks: - proxy ports: - "80:80" volumes: - "/var/run/docker.sock:/tmp/docker.sock:ro" - "./vhost.d:/etc/nginx/vhost.d:ro" agent: image: portainer/agent:lts environment: AGENT_CLUSTER_ADDR: tasks.agent volumes: - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock - /var/lib/docker/volumes:/var/lib/docker/volumes networks: - agent_network deploy: mode: global placement: constraints: [node.platform.os == linux] portainer: image: portainer/portainer-ce:lts command: -H tcp://tasks.agent:9001 --tlsskipverify volumes: - data:/data environment: - VIRTUAL_HOST=portainer.yourdomain.com - VIRTUAL_PORT=9000 ports: - 8000:8000 networks: - proxy - agent_network deploy: mode: replicated replicas: 1 placement: constraints: [node.role == manager] networks: proxy: external: true agent_network: external: true volumes: data: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mounting Host Filesystem for Host Management Features DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows the additional volume mount needed to enable host management features in Portainer Agent, which maps the host root filesystem to /host in the container. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/docker/agent.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` -v /:/host ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Running Portainer Templates Container with Live Updates DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to run the Portainer templates container with a volume mount to enable live updates to the templates.json file without rebuilding the container. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/build.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p "8080:80" -v "${PWD}/templates.json:/usr/share/nginx/html/templates.json" portainer-templates ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Docker CE on Windows Server DESCRIPTION: PowerShell commands to download and execute Microsoft's Docker CE installation script for Windows Container Host Service. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/swarm/wcs.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` Invoke-WebRequest -UseBasicParsing "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoft/Windows-Containers/Main/helpful_tools/Install-DockerCE/install-docker-ce.ps1" -o install-docker-ce.ps1 .\install-docker-ce.ps1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Patching Portainer Deployment for Node Selection DESCRIPTION: kubectl command to patch the Portainer deployment to ensure pod scheduling on a specific node. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/baremetal.md#2025-04-13_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl patch deployments -n portainer portainer -p '{"spec": {"template": {"spec": {"nodeSelector": {"kubernetes.io/hostname": "'$(kubectl get pods -n portainer -o jsonpath='{ ..nodeName }')'"}}}}}}' || (echo Failed to identify current node of portainer pod; exit 1) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose Configuration for Portainer Business Edition with Nginx Proxy DESCRIPTION: Docker Compose configuration for deploying Portainer Business Edition behind Nginx reverse proxy in a standalone Docker environment. Uses nginxproxy/nginx-proxy for automatic proxy configuration. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/nginx.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: "2" services: nginx-proxy: image: nginxproxy/nginx-proxy restart: always ports: - "80:80" volumes: - "/var/run/docker.sock:/tmp/docker.sock:ro" portainer: image: portainer/portainer-ee:lts command: -H unix:///var/run/docker.sock restart: always environment: - VIRTUAL_HOST=portainer.yourdomain.com - VIRTUAL_PORT=9000 ports: - 8000:8000 volumes: - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock - portainer_data:/data volumes: portainer_data: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Portainer Community Edition via Helm DESCRIPTION: Helm command to upgrade Portainer Community Edition to the latest version SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/kubernetes.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm upgrade -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer \ --set image.tag=lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer via YAML with NodePort DESCRIPTION: kubectl command to deploy Portainer using YAML manifests with NodePort exposure. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/baremetal.md#2025-04-13_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -n portainer -f https://downloads.portainer.io/ce-lts/portainer.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Force Update Portainer Deployment DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes command to force restart the Portainer deployment and pull the latest image SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/kubernetes.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl -n portainer rollout restart deployment.apps/portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Edge Agent with mTLS Support in Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Modified Docker service create command for deploying the Portainer Edge Agent with mTLS support. It includes network creation, environment variables, and mounts for the Docker socket and volumes. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/mtls.md#2025-04-13_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker network create \ --driver overlay \ portainer_agent_network; docker service create \ --name portainer_edge_agent \ --network portainer_agent_network \ -e EDGE=1 \ -e EDGE_ID=your-edge-id \ -e EDGE_KEY=your-edge-key \ -e EDGE_INSECURE_POLL=0 \ -e AGENT_CLUSTER_ADDR=tasks.portainer_edge_agent \ --mode global \ --constraint 'node.platform.os == linux' \ --mount type=bind,src=//var/run/docker.sock,dst=/var/run/docker.sock \ --mount type=bind,src=//var/lib/docker/volumes,dst=/var/lib/docker/volumes \ --mount type=bind,src=//,dst=/host \ --mount type=volume,src=portainer_agent_data,dst=/data \ portainer/agent:lts \ --mtlscacert /run/secrets/portainer.mtlscacert \ --mtlscert /run/secrets/portainer.mtlscert \ --mtlskey /run/secrets/portainer.mtlskey ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modifying Docker Volume Path for Non-Standard Locations DESCRIPTION: Example of how to adjust the volume mount in the Portainer Agent deployment command for systems with non-standard Docker volume paths. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/swarm/agent.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` --mount type=bind,src=//srv/data/docker,dst=/var/lib/docker/volumes \ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Portainer Server Access URL DESCRIPTION: The URL to access the Portainer server web interface after installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/swarm/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://localhost:9443 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Podman Socket on Linux DESCRIPTION: Ensures the Podman socket is enabled for communication with Portainer. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/podman/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` systemctl enable --now podman.socket ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building and Running Portainer Templates Container DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to clone the Portainer templates repository, customize the templates file, and build and run it as a container to serve the JSON file on port 8080. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/build.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` git clone https://github.com/portainer/templates.git portainer-templates cd portainer-templates # Edit the file templates.json docker build -t portainer-templates . docker run -d -p "8080:80" portainer-templates ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Restricting Stack Access to Teams Using Docker Compose in YAML DESCRIPTION: This Docker Compose example shows how to deploy a stack and restrict access to teams 'dev' and 'prod' using Portainer access control labels. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/access-control.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: '3.2' services: ltest: image: busybox:latest command: "ping localhost" labels: io.portainer.accesscontrol.teams: dev,prod ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Portainer Helm Repository DESCRIPTION: Commands to add and update the Portainer Helm repository before installation SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm repo add portainer https://portainer.github.io/k8s/ helm repo update ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Docker Secret for Portainer Encryption in Swarm DESCRIPTION: Command to create a Docker secret for Portainer database encryption in a Swarm environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/db-encryption.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` echo "This is a secret" | docker secret create portainer - ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer via Helm with Ingress DESCRIPTION: Helm command to install Portainer CE with Ingress configuration and SSL settings SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm upgrade --install --create-namespace -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer \ --set service.type=ClusterIP \ --set tls.force=true \ --set image.tag=lts \ --set ingress.enabled=true \ --set ingress.ingressClassName= \ --set ingress.annotations."nginx\.ingress\.kubernetes\.io/backend-protocol"=HTTPS \ --set ingress.hosts[0].host= \ --set ingress.hosts[0].paths[0].path="/" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mounting Docker Volumes for Edge Agent Deployment DESCRIPTION: This code snippet demonstrates how to adjust the volume mount in the Edge Agent deployment command when Docker uses a non-standard volume path. It shows an example of changing the source path while keeping the destination path consistent with Edge Agent expectations. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/swarm/edge-async.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` --mount type=bind,src=//srv/data/docker,dst=/var/lib/docker/volumes \ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Stack to Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: This command deploys the Portainer stack to the Docker Swarm cluster using the downloaded YML manifest. It creates a stack named 'portainer' with the Portainer Server and Agent services. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/swarm/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker stack deploy -c portainer-agent-stack.yml portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading Edge Agent Manifest for Kubernetes (Community Edition) DESCRIPTION: Command to download the updated YAML manifest for the Portainer Edge Agent in Kubernetes (Community Edition). SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/edge.md#2025-04-13_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -L https://downloads.portainer.io/ce-lts/portainer-agent-edge-k8s.yaml -o portainer-agent-edge-k8s.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Upgrading Portainer to Business Edition (Load Balancer) using kubectl on Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: This kubectl command applies the latest Portainer Business YAML manifest for a Load Balancer deployment. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Stack Configuration for Portainer Business Edition with Nginx Proxy DESCRIPTION: Docker Stack configuration for deploying Portainer Business Edition with Nginx reverse proxy in a Swarm environment. Includes agent configuration and network setup for cluster management. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/nginx.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: '3.2' services: nginx-proxy: image: nginxproxy/nginx-proxy networks: - proxy ports: - "80:80" volumes: - "/var/run/docker.sock:/tmp/docker.sock:ro" - "./vhost.d:/etc/nginx/vhost.d:ro" agent: image: portainer/agent:lts environment: AGENT_CLUSTER_ADDR: tasks.agent volumes: - /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock - /var/lib/docker/volumes:/var/lib/docker/volumes networks: - agent_network deploy: mode: global placement: constraints: [node.platform.os == linux] portainer: image: portainer/portainer-ee:lts command: -H tcp://tasks.agent:9001 --tlsskipverify volumes: - data:/data environment: - VIRTUAL_HOST=portainer.yourdomain.com - VIRTUAL_PORT=9000 ports: - 8000:8000 networks: - proxy - agent_network deploy: mode: replicated replicas: 1 placement: constraints: [node.role == manager] networks: proxy: external: true agent_network: external: true volumes: data: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Upgrading to Portainer CE 2.0.0 DESCRIPTION: Series of commands to stop, remove, pull, and deploy Portainer CE version 2.0.0 while maintaining persistent data. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/db-encryption.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` containers: - name: portainer image: "portainer/portainer-ee:lts" imagePullPolicy: Always args: volumeMounts: - name: data mountPath: /data - name: portainer-key mountPath: /run/secrets/portainer subPath: portainer ``` LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` spec: containers: portainer: ... volumes: - name: portainer-key secret: secretName: portainer-key items: - key: secret path: portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping Portainer Agent on Podman DESCRIPTION: Command to stop the running Portainer Agent container on Podman.
