It maps the custom Docker volume path to the expected path in the container. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/docker/agent.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` - v /srv/data/docker:/var/lib/docker/volumes \ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer with mTLS via Helm (NodePort) DESCRIPTION: Helm command to install Portainer with mTLS support using the NodePort service type. References the previously created secret containing the mTLS certificates. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/mtls.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm install -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer \ --set mtls.existingSecret=portainer-mtls-certs-secret \ --set enterpriseEdition.enabled=true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Portainer Agent on Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: These commands update the Portainer Agent to the latest version, including pulling the new image and updating the service across the swarm. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/swarm.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker pull portainer/agent:lts docker service update --image portainer/agent:lts --force portainer_agent ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mounting Docker volumes for Edge Agent on non-standard paths DESCRIPTION: When deploying the Edge Agent to an environment with a non-standard Docker volume path, adjust the volume mount in the deployment command. This example shows how to modify the command for a volume path at /srv/data/docker. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/docker/edge-async.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` - v /srv/data/docker:/var/lib/docker/volumes \ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Container with Restricted Access Using Docker CLI DESCRIPTION: This Docker command deploys a container with access restricted to teams 'dev' and 'prod' and user 'bob' using multiple access control labels. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/access-control.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d --label io.portainer.accesscontrol.teams=dev,prod --label io.portainer.accesscontrol.users=bob nginx:latest ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Docker Volume for Portainer Data Storage on Linux DESCRIPTION: Creates a Docker volume named 'portainer_data' that will be used by Portainer Server to store its database files. This ensures data persistence across container restarts or updates. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/docker/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker volume create portainer_data ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing the Portainer Web Interface DESCRIPTION: Shows the URL format to access the Portainer web interface after installation. The interface is available via HTTPS on port 9443, with a note to replace 'localhost' with the appropriate IP address or FQDN if needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/docker/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://localhost:9443 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deleting a Container with Portainer API DESCRIPTION: API call to force delete a container using its ID. The 'force' parameter ensures the container is removed even if it's running. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/api/examples.md#2025-04-13_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` http DELETE /api/endpoints/1/docker/containers/5fc2a93d7a3d426a1c3937436697fc5e5343cc375226f6110283200bede3b107 \ X-API-Key:your_access-token \ force==true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Local Docker Socket Environment via Portainer API DESCRIPTION: HTTP POST request to add a local environment using Docker socket communication. This requires the Docker socket to be mounted in the Portainer container. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/api.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` http --form POST https://my-portainer-server:9443/api/endpoints \ "Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6MSwidXNlcm5hbWUiOiJhZG1pbiIsInJvbGUiOjEsImV4cCI6MTQ5OTM3NjE1NH0.NJ6vE8FY1WG6jsRQzfMqeatJ4vh2TWAeeYfDhP71YEE" \ Name="test-local" EndpointCreationType=1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining YAML Template with Variables for Kubernetes Deployment DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet demonstrates how to define a custom template with variables in Portainer. It includes a variable 'REPLICA_COUNT' that can be adjusted by the user during deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/kubernetes/templates/add.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: nginx-deployment labels: app: nginx spec: replicas: {{ REPLICA_COUNT }} selector: matchLabels: app: nginx template: metadata: labels: app: nginx spec: containers: - name: nginx image: nginx:1.14.2 ports: - containerPort: 80 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Agent Secret Environment Variable in Podman DESCRIPTION: Command line option to set the AGENT_SECRET environment variable when deploying the Portainer Agent container. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/podman/agent.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` -e AGENT_SECRET=yoursecret ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Updated Portainer Agent DESCRIPTION: Command to run the updated Portainer agent container with necessary volume mounts SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/docker.md#2025-04-13_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 9001:9001 --name portainer_agent --restart=always -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /var/lib/docker/volumes:/var/lib/docker/volumes portainer/agent:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Portainer Data Volume with Docker DESCRIPTION: Creates a Docker volume that will be used by Portainer Server to store its database. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/docker/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker volume create portainer_data ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading Portainer Agent Stack Configuration DESCRIPTION: Command to download the Portainer agent stack YAML manifest file from the official Portainer downloads server. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/swarm/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -L https://downloads.portainer.io/ee-lts/portainer-agent-stack.yml -o portainer-agent-stack.yml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer BE using YAML with LoadBalancer Exposure DESCRIPTION: kubectl command to deploy Portainer Business Edition using a YAML manifest with LoadBalancer exposure on ports 9000 (HTTP) and 9443 (HTTPS). SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -n portainer -f https://downloads.portainer.io/ee-lts/portainer-lb.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Referencing Environment Variables in Docker Compose DESCRIPTION: This Docker Compose snippet demonstrates how to reference the 'SERVICE_TAG' environment variable with a fallback value in a service definition. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/stacks/webhooks.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` services: my-service: image: repository/image:${SERVICE_TAG:-stable} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting a Container with Portainer API DESCRIPTION: API call to start a previously created container using its ID. This uses Portainer as a proxy to the Docker ContainerStart API operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/api/examples.md#2025-04-13_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` http POST /api/endpoints/1/docker/containers/5fc2a93d7a3d426a1c3937436697fc5e5343cc375226f6110283200bede3b107/start \ X-API-Key:your_access-token ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose with Environment Variable Reference DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration showing how to reference a webhook environment variable in a Docker Compose file with a fallback value. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/services/webhooks.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` services: my-service: image: repository/image:${SERVICE_TAG:-stable} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping Portainer Container in Docker Standalone DESCRIPTION: This command stops the running Portainer container to prepare for password reset. You need to replace "id-portainer-container" with your actual Portainer container ID or name. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reset-admin.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker stop "id-portainer-container" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Agent Secret to Kubernetes YAML DESCRIPTION: Example of how to add the AGENT_SECRET environment variable to the Kubernetes deployment YAML for Portainer Agent. This is necessary if a secret was specified when starting the Portainer Server container. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/kubernetes/agent.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` env: - name: AGENT_SECRET value: yoursecret ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Stack on Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Docker command to deploy Portainer using the downloaded stack configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/swarm/wcs.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker stack deploy --compose-file=portainer-windows-stack.yml portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Latest Node.js with NVM DESCRIPTION: Uses Node Version Manager (NVM) to install the latest version of Node.js, which is required for Portainer development (v12+ required). SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/contribute/build/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` nvm install node ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Mounting Host Filesystem for Portainer Agent in Docker DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to mount the root of the host filesystem to /host when running the Portainer Agent in Docker. This is required for enabling host management features in Portainer. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/host/setup.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` -v /:/host ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Edge Agent Service in Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Command to update the Portainer Edge Agent service in a Docker Swarm environment to use the new image version. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/edge.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker service update --image portainer/agent:lts --force portainer_edge_agent ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer via YAML with NodePort DESCRIPTION: kubectl command to deploy Portainer using YAML manifest exposed via NodePort SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl apply -n portainer -f https://downloads.portainer.io/ce-lts/portainer.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Force Update Portainer Agent Deployment DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes command to force restart the Portainer agent deployment and pull the latest image SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/kubernetes.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl -n portainer rollout restart deployment.apps/portainer-agent ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer via Helm with NodePort DESCRIPTION: Helm command to install Portainer CE exposed via NodePort on ports 30777 (HTTP) and 30779 (HTTPS) SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm upgrade --install --create-namespace -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer \ --set image.tag=lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Stack Template Definition Example DESCRIPTION: A full example of a stack template for CockroachDB, showing the required structure and properties for stack templates including repository and stackfile references. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_15 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "type": 2, "title": "CockroachDB", "description": "CockroachDB cluster", "note": "Deploys an insecure CockroachDB cluster, please refer to CockroachDB documentation for production deployments.", "categories": ["database"], "platform": "linux", "logo": "https://cloudinovasi.id/assets/img/logos/cockroachdb.png", "repository": { "url": "https://github.com/portainer/templates", "stackfile": "stacks/cockroachdb/docker-stack.yml" } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Docker overlay networks for Portainer deployment DESCRIPTION: Commands to create two overlay networks required for Portainer deployment in Docker Swarm: agent_network and public. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker network create -d overlay agent_network ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker network create -d overlay public ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Environment Variables in Docker Compose DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to define environment variables in a Docker compose file using variable substitution syntax. Variables can be set individually in Portainer or loaded from a .env file. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/edge/stacks/add.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` environment: MY_ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE: ${MY_ENVIRONMENT_VARIABLE} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Agent Secret in Kubernetes YAML DESCRIPTION: YAML snippet showing how to define the AGENT_SECRET environment variable in a Kubernetes deployment manifest for the Edge Agent. This is required when a custom agent secret is set on the Portainer Server. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/kubernetes/edge-async.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` env: - name: AGENT_SECRET value: yoursecret ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Container Restart Policy Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to specify a restart policy for a container, controlling when it automatically restarts. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "restart_policy": "unless-stopped" } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adjusting Volume Path for Non-Standard Podman Locations DESCRIPTION: Example of modifying the volume mount in the Edge Agent deployment command when Podman uses a non-standard volume path. The left side of the mount should reflect the actual Podman volume path, while the right side remains '/var/lib/docker/volumes'. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/podman/edge.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` - v /srv/data/podman:/var/lib/docker/volumes \ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Updated Portainer Business Edition DESCRIPTION: Command to run the updated Portainer Business Edition container with persistent storage and necessary port mappings SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/docker.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name=portainer --restart=always -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ee:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading and Saving Docker Images for MicroK8s Addons DESCRIPTION: Downloads required Docker images for MicroK8s addons and saves them in the expected format and location for offline installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/kube-create/microk8s/offline.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker image pull docker.io/portainer/agent:2.20.3 docker image save docker.io/portainer/agent:2.20.3 -o "$HOME/microk8s/images/docker,io-portainer-agent_2.20.3.tar" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Stack to Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Docker command to deploy Portainer using the downloaded stack configuration SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/swarm/wcs.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker stack deploy --compose-file=portainer-windows-stack.yml portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Kubernetes Secret for Portainer mTLS Certificates DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes command to create a secret containing the mTLS certificates for Portainer. Includes the CA certificate, server certificate, and server key for secure communication. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/mtls.md#2025-04-13_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl create secret generic portainer-mtls-certs-secret -n portainer \ --from-file=mtlsca.crt=ca.crt \ --from-file=mtlscert.crt=server.crt \ --from-file=mtlskey.key=server.key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Portainer Frontend Host Configuration DESCRIPTION: Traefik label for configuring the Portainer frontend host URL SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` - "traefik.http.routers.frontend.rule=Host(`portainer.yourdomain.com`)" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables in Kubernetes YAML for Edge Agent DESCRIPTION: This YAML snippet shows how to set environment variables when deploying the Portainer Edge Agent on Kubernetes. It specifically demonstrates setting the AGENT_SECRET variable, which is crucial if a custom secret is used on the Portainer Server instance. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/kubernetes/edge.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` env: - name: AGENT_SECRET value: yoursecret ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Host Management Features Volume Mount DESCRIPTION: Volume mount configuration to enable host management features in Portainer Agent. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/podman/agent.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` -v /:/host ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling Docker Registry Image Deletion for Self-hosted Registries DESCRIPTION: Environment variable configuration needed for enabling tag deletion functionality in a self-hosted Docker registry. This setting must be added to allow retagging and removing tags from images in the registry. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/registries/manage.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` REGISTRY_STORAGE_DELETE_ENABLED=TRUE ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Remote Docker Environment via Portainer API DESCRIPTION: HTTP POST request to add a remote environment using TCP communication. Requires the Docker API to be exposed on the specified IP address and port. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/api.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` http --form POST https://my-portainer-server:9443/api/endpoints \ "Authorization: Bearer eyJhbGciOiJIUzI1NiIsInR5cCI6IkpXVCJ9.eyJpZCI6MSwidXNlcm5hbWUiOiJhZG1pbiIsInJvbGUiOjEsImV4cCI6MTQ5OTM3NjE1NH0.NJ6vE8FY1WG6jsRQzfMqeatJ4vh2TWAeeYfDhP71YEE" \ Name="test-remote" URL="tcp://10.0.7.10:2375" EndpointCreationType=1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Business Edition with Custom SSL Certificates on Podman DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy Portainer Business Edition with custom SSL certificates, specifying the paths to the certificate and key files. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/podman.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` podman run -d -p 8000:8000 -p 9443:9443 --name=portainer --restart=always --privileged -v /run/podman/podman.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v portainer_data:/data portainer/portainer-ee:lts --sslcert /path/to/cert/portainer.crt --sslkey /path/to/cert/portainer.key ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Retrieving Portainer Agent Stack YML Manifest DESCRIPTION: This command downloads the Portainer agent stack YML manifest from the official Portainer downloads server. The manifest is used to deploy Portainer as a service in a Docker Swarm cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/swarm/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` curl -L https://downloads.portainer.io/ce-lts/portainer-agent-stack.yml -o portainer-agent-stack.yml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using env_file in Docker Compose DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use the env_file directive in a Docker Compose file to load environment variables from an external file. This method is supported in Docker Standalone and Podman environments, but not in Docker Swarm. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/stacks/add.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` env_file: - stack.env ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Traefik ACME Configuration Path DESCRIPTION: Volume mapping configuration for SSL certificate storage in Traefik SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` - "./acme.json:/acme.json" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Portainer Business Edition on Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: These commands update Portainer Business Edition to the latest version, including pulling the new image and updating the service with HTTPS support. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/swarm.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker pull portainer/portainer-ee:lts docker service update --image portainer/portainer-ee:lts --publish-add 9443:9443 --force portainer_portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Containers with Portainer API DESCRIPTION: API call to list all containers in a specific environment (ID: 1) using Portainer as a proxy to the Docker API. The response format follows the Docker API ContainerList operation. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/api/examples.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` http GET /api/endpoints/1/docker/containers/json \ X-API-Key:your_access-token \ all==true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Portainer Server via NodePort in Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands to access Portainer Server using NodePort. The user needs to replace 'localhost' with the appropriate IP address or FQDN if necessary, and adjust the port if it was changed during setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/baremetal.md#2025-04-13_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://localhost:30779/ or http://localhost:30777/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Public Container Using Docker CLI DESCRIPTION: This Docker command deploys a container with the 'public' access control label, making it accessible to all Portainer users. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/access-control.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d --label io.portainer.accesscontrol.public nginx:latest ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring EKSFullAccess Policy in AWS IAM DESCRIPTION: JSON policy definition for EKSFullAccess, granting permissions for EKS management, SSM parameter access, KMS operations, and log retention policy setting. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/settings/credentials/eks.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [ { "Effect": "Allow", "Action": "eks:*", "Resource": "*" }, { "Action": [ "ssm:GetParameter", "ssm:GetParameters" ], "Resource": [ "arn:aws:ssm:*::parameter/aws/*", "arn:aws:ssm:*::parameter/aws/*" ], "Effect": "Allow" }, { "Action": [ "kms:CreateGrant", "kms:DescribeKey" ], "Resource": "*", "Effect": "Allow" }, { "Action": [ "logs:PutRetentionPolicy" ], "Resource": "*", "Effect": "Allow" } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Environment Variables for Portainer Template in JSON DESCRIPTION: Illustrates the structure for defining environment variables in a Portainer template, including various input types and configurations. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_19 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "env": [ { "name": "MYSQL_ROOT_PASSWORD", "label": "Root password", "description": "Password used by the root user." }, { "name": "ENV_VAR_WITH_DEFAULT_VALUE", "default": "default_value", "preset": true }, { "name": "ENV_VAR_WITH_SELECT_VALUE", "label": "An environment variable", "description": "A description for this env var", "select": [ { "text": "Yes, I agree", "value": "Y", "default": true }, { "text": "No, I disagree", "value": "N" }, { "text": "Maybe", "value": "YN" } ], "description": "Some environment variable." } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Stack to Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Deploys the Portainer stack using the downloaded YML manifest file to create the Portainer Server and Agent services. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/swarm/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker stack deploy -c portainer-agent-stack.yml portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Portainer Business Edition via Helm DESCRIPTION: Helm command to upgrade Portainer Business Edition to the latest version SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/kubernetes.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm upgrade -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer \ --set enterpriseEdition.image.tag=lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Basic Nginx Docker Compose with Relative Path DESCRIPTION: A simple Docker Compose configuration for Nginx that demonstrates relative path volume mounting from the same directory level as the compose file. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/relative-paths.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` version: '3.1' services: webapp: image: nginx:latest restart: always ports: - "3002:80" volumes: - ./static:/usr/share/nginx/html ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Portainer Web Interface DESCRIPTION: Example URL for accessing the Portainer web interface after installation SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/swarm/wcs.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://localhost:9443 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Webhook URL with Environment Variables DESCRIPTION: Example of a webhook URL that includes an environment variable SERVICE_TAG with a specific value. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/services/webhooks.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` https://portainer:9443/api/webhooks/1d251d96-fb34-4172-a0a1-d0655467b897?SERVICE_TAG=development ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Categories for Portainer Template in JSON DESCRIPTION: Illustrates how to associate categories with a template, which are used for filtering in the Portainer UI. Users can override this path if needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/swarm/socket.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` /var/run/docker.sock ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Docker CE on Windows Server DESCRIPTION: PowerShell commands to download and execute Microsoft's script for installing the Windows Container Host Service and Docker CE on a Windows server. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/docker/wcs.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` Invoke-WebRequest -UseBasicParsing "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/microsoft/Windows-Containers/Main/helpful_tools/Install-DockerCE/install-docker-ce.ps1" -o install-docker-ce.ps1 .\install-docker-ce.ps1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Portainer Stack on Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Docker command to deploy the Portainer stack on Docker Swarm using the downloaded YML manifest. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/settings/authentication/ldap.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: plaintext CODE: ``` (&(objectclass=group)(cn=*Portainer*)) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer via Helm with Ingress DESCRIPTION: Helm command to install Portainer CE with Ingress configuration for custom hostname access. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/baremetal.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm upgrade --install --create-namespace -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer \ --set service.type=ClusterIP \ --set tls.force=true \ --set image.tag=lts \ --set ingress.enabled=true \ --set ingress.ingressClassName= \ --set ingress.annotations."nginx\.ingress\.kubernetes\.io/backend-protocol"=HTTPS \ --set ingress.hosts[0].host= \ --set ingress.hosts[0].paths[0].path="/" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Extracting Golang v1.17 from Tar Archive DESCRIPTION: Extracts the downloaded Go v1.17 archive to the /usr/local directory, which is the standard location for Go installation on Linux. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/contribute/build/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo tar -C /usr/local -xzf go1.17.6.linux-amd64.tar.gz ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Portainer Community Edition on Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: These commands update Portainer Community Edition to the latest version, including pulling the new image and updating the service with HTTPS support. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/stacks/webhooks.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` https://portainer:9443/api/stacks/webhooks/1d251d96-fb34-4172-a0a1-d0655467b897?SERVICE_TAG=development ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying Updated Edge Agent in Docker Standalone DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the updated Portainer Edge Agent in a Docker Standalone environment, requiring Edge identifier and Edge key. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/edge.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock -v /var/lib/docker/volumes:/var/lib/docker/volumes -v /:/host -v portainer_agent_data:/data --restart always -e EDGE=1 -e EDGE_ID=your-edge-identifier-here -e EDGE_KEY=your-edge-key-here -e EDGE_INSECURE_POLL=1 --name portainer_edge_agent portainer/agent:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Administrator-Only Access for Portainer Template in JSON DESCRIPTION: Shows how to configure a template to be accessible only by admin users using the administrator_only field. This command forces an update of the portainer_portainer service with the enterprise edition image. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/ssl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl create namespace portainer ``` LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl create secret tls portainer-tls-secret -n portainer \ --cert=/path/to/cert/file \ --key=/path/to/key/file ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Updating Portainer Service with Encryption Secret in Docker Swarm DESCRIPTION: Docker service update command to add the encryption secret to an existing Portainer deployment in Swarm. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/db-encryption.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker service update \ --secret-add src=portainer,target="/run/secrets/portainer" \ portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Docker's GPG Key Fingerprint DESCRIPTION: Displays the fingerprint of the Docker GPG key to verify its authenticity before proceeding with installation. Update stack container images with different tag

SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/settings/credentials/eks.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "Version": "2012-10-17", "Statement": [ { "Effect": "Allow", "Action": [ "iam:CreateInstanceProfile", "iam:DeleteInstanceProfile", "iam:GetInstanceProfile", "iam:RemoveRoleFromInstanceProfile", "iam:GetRole", "iam:CreateRole", "iam:DeleteRole", "iam:AttachRolePolicy", "iam:PutRolePolicy", "iam:ListInstanceProfiles", "iam:AddRoleToInstanceProfile", "iam:ListInstanceProfilesForRole", "iam:PassRole", "iam:DetachRolePolicy", "iam:DeleteRolePolicy", "iam:GetRolePolicy", "iam:GetOpenIDConnectProvider", "iam:CreateOpenIDConnectProvider", "iam:DeleteOpenIDConnectProvider", "iam:TagOpenIDConnectProvider", "iam:ListAttachedRolePolicies", "iam:TagRole", "iam:GetPolicy", "iam:CreatePolicy", "iam:DeletePolicy", "iam:ListPolicyVersions" ], "Resource": [ "arn:aws:iam:::instance-profile/eksctl-*", "arn:aws:iam:::role/eksctl-*", "arn:aws:iam:::policy/eksctl-*", "arn:aws:iam:::oidc-provider/*", "arn:aws:iam:::role/aws-service-role/eks-nodegroup.amazonaws.com/AWSServiceRoleForAmazonEKSNodegroup", "arn:aws:iam:::role/eksctl-managed-*" ] }, { "Effect": "Allow", "Action": [ "iam:GetRole" ], "Resource": [ "arn:aws:iam:::role/*" ] }, { "Effect": "Allow", "Action": [ "iam:CreateServiceLinkedRole" ], "Resource": "*", "Condition": { "StringEquals": { "iam:AWSServiceName": [ "eks.amazonaws.com", "eks-nodegroup.amazonaws.com", "eks-fargate.amazonaws.com" ] } } } ] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Making GET Request with API Token DESCRIPTION: Example of making an HTTP GET request to the Portainer stacks endpoint using httpie with an API token for authentication. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/podman/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://localhost:9443 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Pulling Latest Portainer Business Edition Image DESCRIPTION: Command to pull the latest Business Edition LTS image from Docker Hub SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/docker.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker pull portainer/portainer-ee:lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Up Docker's Stable Repository DESCRIPTION: Adds Docker's stable repository to the system's package sources, using the appropriate Ubuntu release codename automatically. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/mtls.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl create namespace portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Modified API Endpoints DESCRIPTION: List of modified API endpoints with changes to path parameters, query parameters, and responses. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/release-notes.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: http CODE: ``` GET /cloud/{provider}/info PUT /custom_templates/{id} GET /docker/{environmentId}/containers/{containerID}/image_status GET /docker/{environmentId}/services/{serviceID}/image_status GET /docker/{environmentId}/snapshot/containers/{containerId} GET /docker/{environmentId}/stacks/{id}/images_status ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Adding Volume Mount for Host Management Features in Portainer Agent DESCRIPTION: Code snippet showing how to add a volume mount to enable host management features in the Portainer Agent deployment. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/swarm/agent.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` --mount type=bind,src=//,dst=/host ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Table - Host and Filesystem Options DESCRIPTION: Table describing host management and volume management configuration options in Portainer SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/swarm/setup.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Option | Overview | | ----------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Enable host management features | Enabling host management features allows you to see the available devices and storage on the physical nodes across your cluster as well as browse the nodes' filesystems. | | Enable volume management for non-administrators | Enabling this feature allows non-administrator users to manage volumes on an environment. If this is disabled, users below administrator level have read-only access to volumes. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Patching Portainer Deployment to Set Node Affinity DESCRIPTION: kubectl command to patch the Portainer deployment to ensure it's always scheduled on the same node it's currently running on, using nodeSelector. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl patch deployments -n portainer portainer -p '{"spec": {"template": {"spec": {"nodeSelector": {"kubernetes.io/hostname": "'$(kubectl get pods -n portainer -o jsonpath='{ ..nodeName }')'"}}}}}}' || (echo Failed to identify current node of portainer pod; exit 1) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Template Categories Configuration DESCRIPTION: Example showing how to assign categories to a template, which are used for filtering in the Portainer UI. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/app-templates/format.md#2025-04-13_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "categories": ["webserver", "open-source"] } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading Portainer Windows Stack Configuration DESCRIPTION: Command to download the Portainer Windows stack YML configuration file SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/swarm/wcs.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` curl https://downloads.portainer.io/ce-lts/portainer_windows_stack.yml -o portainer-windows-stack.yml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Sample Kubeconfig File Structure in YAML DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows the structure of a kubeconfig file generated by Portainer. It includes cluster information, context, and user authentication details. The server URL points to the Portainer Server instance rather than the Kubernetes cluster directly. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/kubernetes/kubeconfig.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: v1 clusters: - cluster: insecure-skip-tls-verify: true server: https://my-portainer-server:9443/api/endpoints/1/kubernetes name: portainer-cluster-kubernetes contexts: - context: cluster: portainer-cluster-kubernetes user: portainer-sa-clusteradmin name: portainer-ctx-kubernetes current-context: portainer-ctx-kubernetes kind: Config preferences: {} users: - name: portainer-sa-clusteradmin user: token: xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Setting Node Selector for Portainer Deployment DESCRIPTION: kubectl command to patch the Portainer deployment with node selector configuration SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` kubectl patch deployments -n portainer portainer -p '{"spec": {"template": {"spec": {"nodeSelector": {"kubernetes.io/hostname": "'$(kubectl get pods -n portainer -o jsonpath='{ ..nodeName }')'"}}}}}}' || (echo Failed to identify current node of portainer pod; exit 1) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Portainer Server Container DESCRIPTION: Command to remove the stopped Portainer server container while preserving data volumes SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/docker.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker rm portainer ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker API Version Error Message DESCRIPTION: Error message displayed when running Portainer with Docker Engine <= 19.03 due to API version incompatibility between client and daemon. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/release-notes.md#2025-04-13_snippet_11 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` failed initializing upgrade service | error="failed to determine container platform: failed to retrieve docker info: Error response from daemon: client version 1.41 is too new. Maximum supported API version is 1.40" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Table - Docker Security Settings DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive table listing Docker security configuration options and their implications SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/swarm/setup.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Option | Overview | | ----------------------------------------------------- | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | | Disable bind mounts for non-administrators | Prevents non-admin users within Portainer from using bind mounts when creating containers and/or services/stacks. When toggled on, the option to attach to a host file system path is removed. | | Disable privileged mode for non-administrators | Prevents non-admin users from elevating the privilege of a container to bypass SELinux/AppArmor. When toggled on, the option to select **Privileged** mode when [adding a container](../containers/add.md) is removed. | | Disable the use of host PID 1 for non-administrators | Prevents non-admin users from requesting that a deployed container operates as the host PID. This is a security risk if used by a non-trustworthy authorized user because when they operate as PID1, they are in effect able to run any command in the container console as root on the host. | | Disable the use of Stacks for non-administrators | This is a 'sledgehammer' approach to removing any possibility for non-admin users within Portainer to find and use weaknesses in the Docker architecture. Whilst Portainer has the ability to disable some of the more common exploits, we cannot possibly block them all because there are any number of capabilities that could be added to a container to attempt to gain access to the host. This feature simply allows an admin to disable all possible entry points. | | Disable device mappings for non-administrators | Blocks users from mapping host devices into containers. Whilst the ability to map devices is generally used for good (e.g. mapping a GPU into a container), it can equally be used by non-trustworthy authorized users to map a physical storage device into a container. It is possible to mount `/dev/sda1` into a container, and then from a console of that container, the user would have complete access to the sda1 device without restriction. By toggling this on, Portainer blocks the ability for non-admins to map ANY devices into containers. | | Disable container capabilities for non-administrators | Toggle on to hide the **Container capabilities** tab for non-administrators when they are [adding a container](../containers/add.md). | | Disable sysctl settings for non-administrators | Toggle on to stop non-admin users from using sysctl options, preventing them from recreating, duplicating or editing containers. | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Stopping and Removing Edge Agent in Docker Standalone DESCRIPTION: Commands to stop and remove the existing Portainer Edge Agent container in a Docker Standalone environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/edge.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker stop portainer_edge_agent docker rm portainer_edge_agent ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Directory Structure for MicroK8s Offline Installation DESCRIPTION: Creates the necessary directory structure in the SSH user's home directory for storing MicroK8s installation files and images. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/ssl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker run -d -p 9443:9443 -p 8000:8000 \ --name portainer --restart always \ -v /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock \ -v portainer_data:/data \ -v /etc/letsencrypt/live/yourdomain:/certs/live/yourdomain:ro \ -v /etc/letsencrypt/archive/yourdomain:/certs/archive/yourdomain:ro \ portainer/portainer-ee:lts \ --sslcert /certs/live/yourdomain/fullchain.pem \ --sslkey /certs/live/yourdomain/privkey.pem ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Portainer Web Interface DESCRIPTION: URL to access the Portainer web interface after installation. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reset-admin.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` 2020/06/04 00:13:58 Password successfully updated for user: admin 2020/06/04 00:13:58 Use the following password to login: &_4#\3^5V8vLTd)E"NWiJBs26G*9HPl1 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Output of Creating New Admin User DESCRIPTION: This shows the console output when the password reset helper cannot find an existing admin user and creates a new one. This might happen if the database is corrupted or the user was deleted. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reset-admin.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` 2022/08/10 07:36:33 [WARN] Unable to retrieve user with ID 1, will try to create, err: object not found inside the database 2022/08/10 07:36:33 Admin user admin-u0512b3f0v4dqk7o successfully created 2022/08/10 07:36:33 Use the following password to login: Sr#]YL_6D0k8Pd{pA9^|}F32j5J4I=av ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Listing Docker Services in Swarm DESCRIPTION: This command lists all services running in the Docker Swarm cluster, allowing users to identify the Portainer services for updating. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/upgrade/swarm.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker service ls ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Portainer Server via NodePort in Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands to access Portainer Server using NodePort method. Users should replace 'localhost' with the appropriate IP address or FQDN if needed, and adjust the port if changed during setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/kubernetes/baremetal.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://localhost:30779/ or http://localhost:30777/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Moving and Renaming Downloaded MicroK8s Files DESCRIPTION: Moves the downloaded MicroK8s and Core20 files to the correct directory and renames them to the expected filenames for Portainer. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/kube-create/microk8s/offline.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` mv microk8s_*.snap $HOME/microk8s/microk8s.snap mv microk8s_*.assert $HOME/microk8s/microk8s.assert mv core20_*.snap $HOME/microk8s/core20.snap mv core20_*.assert $HOME/microk8s/core20.assert ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Container Creation Response Format DESCRIPTION: Sample response from the container creation API call showing the container ID and any warnings. This ID is needed for subsequent operations on the container. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/api/examples.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` { "Id": "5fc2a93d7a3d426a1c3937436697fc5e5343cc375226f6110283200bede3b107", "Warnings": null } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Docker Compose Deployment Command DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the Portainer stack using Docker Compose SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` docker-compose up -d ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading MicroK8s and Core20 Snap Packages DESCRIPTION: Downloads the MicroK8s and Core20 snap packages for offline installation. This example uses version 1.27 of MicroK8s. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/environments/add/kube-create/microk8s/offline.md#2025-04-13_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` snap download microk8s --channel 1.27 snap download core20 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Portainer Web Interface DESCRIPTION: This URL is used to access the Portainer web interface after installation. It uses HTTPS and the default port 9443. The 'localhost' should be replaced with the appropriate IP address or FQDN if needed. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/swarm/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://localhost:9443 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Docker volume for Portainer data persistence DESCRIPTION: Command to create a Docker volume named portainer_data for storing Portainer's persistent data. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` docker volume create portainer_data ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Downloading Portainer Windows Stack Configuration DESCRIPTION: Command to download the Portainer Windows stack YML configuration file. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/swarm/wcs.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: powershell CODE: ``` curl https://downloads.portainer.io/ee-lts/portainer_windows_stack.yml -o portainer-windows-stack.yml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Portainer Web Interface DESCRIPTION: URL to access the Portainer web interface after installation. By default, Portainer uses HTTPS on port 9443. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install/server/swarm/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://localhost:9443 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Unauthorized API Request Example DESCRIPTION: Example of making an HTTP GET request to a restricted endpoint and the resulting error response. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/api/access.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` http GET https://portainer:9443/api/settings X-API-Key:your_api_key_here ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Portainer Edge Host Configuration DESCRIPTION: Traefik label for configuring the Portainer Edge host URL SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` - "traefik.http.routers.edge.rule=Host(`edge.yourdomain.com`)" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Let's Encrypt Email Configuration DESCRIPTION: Configuration line for specifying the Let's Encrypt registration email SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/traefik.md#2025-04-13_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` - --certificatesresolvers.leresolver.acme.email=your-email ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Markdown Documentation Structure for Swarm Environment DESCRIPTION: Markdown structure defining the documentation layout for Swarm environment management, including navigation links to detailed sections for environment details, cluster visualization, setup, and registries. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/user/docker/swarm/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` # Swarm {% hint style="info" %} The **Swarm** menu is only available to Docker Swarm environments. {% endhint %} This section provides an overview of your Swarm environment. You can view information about environments and nodes, view cluster information, and configure environment-specific settings. {% content-ref url="details.md" %} [details.md](details.md) {% endcontent-ref %} {% content-ref url="cluster-visualizer.md" %} [cluster-visualizer.md](cluster-visualizer.md) {% endcontent-ref %} {% content-ref url="setup.md" %} [setup.md](setup.md) {% endcontent-ref %} {% content-ref url="registries.md" %} [registries.md](registries.md) {% endcontent-ref %} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Content References in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Markdown content references using Jekyll-style linking syntax to connect related documentation pages for team management. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/admin/user/teams/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` {% content-ref url="add.md" %} [add.md](add.md) {% endcontent-ref %} {% content-ref url="add-user.md" %} [add-user.md](add-user.md) {% endcontent-ref %} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Content Reference Links in Markdown DESCRIPTION: Markdown syntax for linking to Traefik and nginx configuration guides using custom content reference tags. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/advanced/reverse-proxy/README.md#2025-04-13_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` {% content-ref url="traefik.md" %} [traefik.md](traefik.md) {% endcontent-ref %} {% content-ref url="nginx.md" %} [nginx.md](nginx.md) {% endcontent-ref %} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Portainer Server via Load Balancer in Bash DESCRIPTION: Commands to access Portainer Server using a Load Balancer. The user needs to replace '' with the IP address or FQDN of the load balancer, and adjust the port if it was changed during setup. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/baremetal.md#2025-04-13_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` https://:9443/ or http://:9000/ ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Portainer via Helm with Load Balancer DESCRIPTION: Helm command to install Portainer CE exposed via Load Balancer on ports 9000 (HTTP) and 9443 (HTTPS) SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/start/install-ce/server/kubernetes/wsl.md#2025-04-13_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` helm upgrade --install --create-namespace -n portainer portainer portainer/portainer \ --set service.type=LoadBalancer \ --set image.tag=lts ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Wget on Ubuntu DESCRIPTION: Installs the Wget utility, which is used for retrieving files using common internet protocols and is required for the Portainer development environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/contribute/build/linux.md#2025-04-13_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` apt-get install wget ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Checking Node.js Version on macOS DESCRIPTION: Command to verify the installed version of Node.js. SOURCE: https://github.com/portainer/portainer-docs/blob/2.27/contribute/build/mac.md#2025-04-13_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` node --version ```
